intro: Chrysoscias argentea, commonly known as silver chrysos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are covered in a silvery, powdery coating. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the cooler months. Chrysoscias argentea is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water.
